alert.note: Alert for Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Delaware; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Thunderstorms producing heavy rain will impact portions of southeastern Buchanan, northeastern Keokuk, west central Cedar, Johnson, Benton, northwestern Washington, southwestern Delaware, Linn and eastern Iowa Counties through 330 AM CDT... At 227 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking heavy rain producing thunderstorms along a line extending from La Porte City to near Hills. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rainfall, lightning and additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding of ponding of water on roadways, low visibilities, and rises in small streams and creeks. Strong thunderstorms will be near... University Heights and Hills around 230 AM CDT. Iowa City around 235 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include West Branch. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 215 and 253. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 48. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If rainfall does not slow soon a flash flood warning may be needed soon for some areas, especially the Iowa City area.

area.areaDesc: Benton; Buchanan; Cedar; Delaware; Iowa; Johnson; Keokuk; Linn; Washington
